resources.string: \ Sudoku is a logic-based number placement puzzle. Starting with a partially completed 9x9 grid, the objective is to fill the grid so that each row, each column, and each of the 3x3 boxes (also called blocks) contains the digits 1 to 9 exactly once.

\ The game begins with a 4x4 tray of cubes containing letters so that only the top letter of each cube is visible. A three-minute sand timer is started. Player should search for words that can be constructed from the letters of sequentially adjacent cubes horizontally, vertically or diagonally neighboring. Words must be at least three letters long, may include singular and plural (or other derived forms) separately, but may not use the same letter cube more than once per word (unless it appears twice- having more than one die with an "s" on it, for example). After three minutes have elapsed, the game stops and the player scores based on the words formed. Player receives one point for each unique word formed.

I thank all of the sources which helped me develop this project. My special thanks to, Google Images, from which I picked my icon for Boggle game and the websites, developer.android.com and stackoverflow.com and code examples(Sudoku example from previous week assignment) for helping me eliminate few bugs in my program. I also thank my friend Sarang Zargar, who suggested me the search from dictionary.
Ths game was developed by a team of 2 members. Team Member Information: Sudhamayi Nanduri(Contact: nanduri.s@husky.neu.edu), Vikranth Reddy(Contact: etikyala.v@husky.neu.edu)
We would like to thank android.developer.com and stackoverflow.com for helping us from time to time. Special thanks to google.com for the boggle images.

It is a multi-player Boggle game with pairs of 2 playing against each other. You can receive the notifications of the opponent’s moves and score, if the internet is on. The game shows the final scores and who has the highest scores.For the game-play, the player has to choose an opponent. It is a competition based on the score.The player with highest score wins the game. The score is based on the words made: 1 point for 3 letter word, 2 points for 4 letter word, 3 points for 5 letter word and so on. To play with an other player, the user needs to enter other player name and initiate the game. For a single player game, the user just needs to initiate game without entering any of the other player names. For this simulation, the user ids that can be used are: "alex","bob","mary","john". The password for all the user ids is "adgj". Note: Enter one of these ids to initiate a game. The requests are pulled once on signing in only if the internet is on, else it shows a blank screen. To pull the game requests again, the user needs to sign in.

string-array.name: question
string-array.item: Do you think your friend is cute?
Do you think your friend stinks?
Do you think your friend is handsome / beautiful?
Do you think your friend is highly educated?
Do you think your friend has good manners?
Do you think your friend is clean?
Do you think your friend is loving and caring?
Do you think your friend is born lucky?
Do you think your friend eat a lot?
Do you think your friend drinks and smokes?
Do you think your friend has bad habits?

 This application was tested on Nexus 7.

Do you want to leave a surprise message for your friend? Do you want it to be timed? Do you want to make it a message hunt? \n \nThis messenger application enables you to do all this exciting stuff! Just create your account to login and surprise your friends!
If you want to test the app before creating your own account, you can use the following user ids and passwords: \n 1. user id: joey, password: qwerty \n 2. user id: monica, password:qwerty
